long: Meaning: properly, to "score" with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to "inscribe", and also to "enumerate"; intensively, to "recount", i.e. "celebrate".  Usage: commune, (ac-) count; declare, number,   penknife, reckon, scribe, shew forth, speak, talk, tell (out), writer.  Source: a primitive root;
